text: 2 oz. Parmesan, finely grated (about 1 cup), divided
label: ingredient

text: 1 head of romaine, core removed, leaves separated.
label: ingredient

text: In a large bowl, whisk buttermilk, paprika, cayenne, and 1 Tbsp. salt. Add chicken, turning to fully coat. Tightly cover bowl (or transfer to a large resealable bag, pressing out excess air, and seal).
label: step

text: Refrigerate at least 2 hours and up to overnight.
label: step

text: In a medium bowl, combine anchovies, garlic, mayonnaise, mustard, lemon juice, Worcestershire, and 3/4 cup Parmesan; season with 1/2 tsp. salt and 1/2 tsp. pepper and stir until thickened. Refrigerate until ready to use.
label: step

text: Arrange a rack in center of oven; preheat to 375°. In a large bowl, whisk flour and 2 tsp. salt.
label: step

text: Arrange bottoms of buns cut sides up and tops of buns cut sides down on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Brush with butter; top with remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan.
label: step

text: Bake buns until golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer sheet to a wire rack.
label: step

text: Working one piece at a time, remove chicken from brine. Place in flour dredge and thoroughly coat, pressing flour to adhere. Dredge in brine, then in flour again to have a double coating. Transfer to a baking sheet or plate.
label: step

text: Into a large Dutch oven or heavy pot fitted with a deep-fry thermometer, pour oil to a depth of 3". Heat over medium heat until thermometer registers 325°. Place a wire rack set in a baking sheet next to the stovetop; alternatively, line a baking sheet with paper towels.
label: step

text: Fry chicken, adjusting heat as needed to maintain oil temperature between 300° and 325°, until deeply golden and an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest part registers 165°, 4 to 5 minutes. Transfer to prepared rack.
label: step

text: In a large bowl, toss romaine with 1/4 cup dressing. Spread remaining dressing across bottom buns. Add chicken, then top with romaine, keeping it as flat as possible for easier stacking. Close with top buns, gently press down, and secure each with a skewer (if desired).
label: step
